name: Carolyn's Orange Rolls
author: Heidi
summary: Orange rolls - very soft white flour dough with grated orange rind, butter and sugar filling.  Excellent recipe for parties, always a crowd pleaser!
ingredients: ⅔ cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water
Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes
Combine the diced butter, 1/2 cup sugar, and salt in a large bowl
Stir in the hot milk, and mix to dissolve the butter
Mix the yeast, eggs, and flour into the milk mixture to form a sticky dough
Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl and turn to coat with oil
Cover with a damp cloth, and let rise in the refrigerator for 8 hours or overnight
Remove dough from the refrigerator 2 to 2 1/2 hours before baking
Roll each half out on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thick rectangle
Mix the softened butter, one cup sugar, and orange peel in a bowl
Roll up the dough along the long edge
Cut the rolls into one inch slices with dental floss
Let rise until doubled in bulk
Bake in a preheated 400 degree F (205 degree C) oven for 10 to 15 minutes, or until golden brown
